FRS_Method: GPS CODE (PSEUDO RANGE) STANDARD POSITION (SA OFF)

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
A. The City of Lauderhill Department of Environmental and Engineering Services accidental release prevention
program involves a unified approach that integrates technologies, procedures, and management practices. All 
applicable procedures of the USEPA Prevention Program are followed. The City is included in the Emergency
Response Plan for District XI Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC). The emergency response
policy includes this plan, and procedures for evaluating and mitigating minor on-site releases. The response
policy is in compliance with USEPA Emergency Response Program requirements.

B. The City of Lauderhill WTP includes a chlorination system, which serves to disinfect the City water supply.
The system delivers chlorine gas ffom one-ton liquid chlorine containers through gas feeders and vacuum
chlorinators. Each vacuum-type chlorinator has a built-in automatic shutdown in the event of a pipe leak,
thereby minimizing the amount of chlorine gas released to the atmosphere. There is no presuurized piping
in the chlorination system. The chlorination system is housed in an enclosed building, including leak detection
and alarms, as well as an emergency chlorine scrubber, designed for catastrophic failure of a chlorine
container.A total of twelve one-ton containers may be on-site at any one time, with four containers on-line.
The facilty is staffed by licensed operators 24 hours per day, 365 days per year.

C. The off-site consequence analysis includes "worst-case" and "alternative" scenarios. Both have been 
modeled in accordance with USEPA RMP COMP.

D. The general accidental release prevention program is based on the following key elements:
     -High level of operator training
     -Preventative maintenance program
     -State-of-the-art process and safety equipment
     -Use of accurate and effective operating procedures, with operator input
     -Performance of hazard review
     -Implementation of an auditing and inspection program

E. No accidental r

eleases of chlorine have occurred at this facility in the past five years.

F. The facility is included in the District XI LEPC Emergency Response Plan, with response from City
Fire Rescue.

G. Changes to improve safety have been completed since the last hazard review, including scrubber
installation.
